heading: ***WINTER AND ICE STORM WARNINGS FOR THE ST. LAWRENCE VALLEY, SOUTHERN ADIRONDACKS, EASTERN VT AND CENTRAL NH, AND WEATHER ADVISORIES ELSEWHERE, ENDING LATE MORNING IN SOUTHERN VT, LATE AFTERNOON IN NY AND VT, AND EVENING IN NH******WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ST. LAWRENCE VALLEY, SOUTHERN GREEN MOUNTAINS AND BERKSHIRES***Today
text: Freezing rain and rain tapering to rain showers. Some snow showers this afternoon in NY, into western VT late. Highs in the 30s northeast, low to mid 40s southwest, falling west to east this afternoon. South winds 10 to 15 mph, shifting to the southwest, gusting 20 to 35 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: Rain or snow showers, changing to snow showers and ending. Brief clearing, then passing snow showers in the north and mountains, a dusting to 2 inches at higher elevations. Blustery and much colder. Lows in the teens, a few single numbers over the higher terrain north. Winds southwest 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph.

heading: Tuesday
text: Mostly cloudy, with limited sun in southern valleys, and scattered snow showers in the north and mountains, numerous over the higher terrain, with a dusting to 2 inches. Blustery and cold. Highs 10 to 15 north, upper teens near 20 south. Winds becoming west 10 to 20 mph, gusting 25 to 35 mph.
